pressreleasecomponen.bodycontent: I was diagnosed with Type 1 about eight years ago, having had the classic symptoms of thirst, frequent trips to the toilet and unexplained weight loss. I'm a competitive white-water canoeist so finger prick testing was always difficult on the water. I also have extra challenges on race days where I must carefully time eating, insulin and closely monitor my levels right up to the point I get to the start line. But I've never used diabetes as an excuse for a bad race. There have been a couple of times I've not been at my best because of low or high sugars, but most of the time if I
pressreleasecomponen.subtitle: In the zone part 3
